intro: Saxifraga delphinensis, commonly known as the Delphin's saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Saxifragaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand cold temperatures, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Saxifraga delphinensis is often found in meadows and on slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
